posts.message:
I wanted to have a private git repo, we use github at work, and I saw the private pricing which was 7 usd for 5 private repos
https://github.com/pricing
checked bit bucket and it was similar but by users
https://bitbucket.org/plans/

I found gitlab, they offer a pricey enterprise edition, I expected the free edition to be shitty but I was surprised that it was more than perfect for my needs.
the only issue that it was raping my ram :). but it's still cheaper solution than github/bitbucket as the only cost is the git server you're running

https://about.gitlab.com/

posts.description: ماهو الـ unite testing و كيف تستخدمه مع codeigniter khashabawy 12/03/2015 لا يوجد تعليقات 2 مشاهدة ال unit testing أصبح الآن من المتطلبات الأساسية الواجب على المبرمج الإلمام بها ليتم قبوله للعمل فى معظم الشركات , فما هو ؟ إختبار الوحدة : هو عبارة عن دالة إضافية تضعها داخل كل class تقوم بكتابته و مهم…

posts.message:
الكود والداتا , الطاقة والمادة

يمكن تحويل المادة لطاقة مثلاً احراق قطعة خشب ينتج عنه ضواء وحرارة
كذلك يمكن تحويل الداتا لكود مثل
eval(db.Get("myscript"))

يمكن تحويل الطاقة لمادة, مثلاً عملية البناء الضوائى فى النبات (مثال ضعيف)
كذلك يمكن تحويل الكود لداتا مثلاً
MyObject.Serilize() 
(مثال ضعيف برضك, عشان تركيب الابجكت كداتا)

اهى فلسفة وخلاص :)
Simply, it enables Arduino users to use the power of their smartphone's internet connection in their sketch. Feedback is appreciated even If you don't have 1Sheeld hardware.
posts.description:
We have released our most advanced - and most requested - shield ever, the Internet shield!

It is a full feature-rich HTTP client that enables you to make HTTP requests right from your Arduino sketch without the hassle of the configuring regular Ethernet/WiFi shields out there.

The possibilities are unlimited, you can control your home lights from anywhere in the world using a text file on Dropbox and a couple of lines in Arduino sketch or even control the color of an RGB LED using a live weather feed.

Our awesome Internet shield lets you interface any REST api and consume its data right inside your Arduino sketch, even if that api returns thousands of lines in JSON format.

Here is a tutorial on how to use the Internet shield to log data graphically on ThingSpeak! http://1sheeld.com/?p=7404

Visit our website to download the latest version of the app and the Arduino library or to know the detailed change log: http://www.1sheeld.com/downloads

For a the full documentation of the shield:
http://1sheeld.com/docs/internet/
